thread.title: Perak police detain man who shouted "bomb in car"
thread.title_full: Perak police detain man who shouted "bomb in car" - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Perak police detain man who shouted "bomb in car"
text:
PARIT: A 30-year-old man was arrested by police for causing panic when he allegedly shouted that he had a "bomb" in his car at a traffic light junction Bota Kiri, near here Saturday.
Perak Tengah OCPD Superintendent Mohamad Zainal Abdullah said police personnel, who were on duty at the Le Tour de Langkawi cycling race route in the area, managed to apprehend the man who tried to flee from his vehicle with the engine left running at the side of the road.
According to an eye-witness at the scene which happened at 11am, the man suddenly stopped his car at the side of the road and started shouting that he had a bomb in the car.
He went on shouting for other people to run, causing a panic among other motorists. The witness said he saw the man get into another car.
"Our bomb squad is still investigating the claims of this man and inspecting his vehicle.
"We are also still trying to find out the motive behind his confession to the police," said OCPD Mohamad Zainal, adding that further details will be released once investigations are completed.
